00052 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 //  STRUCT : sc_trace_params
00054 //
00055 //  Struct for storing the trace file and object name of an sc_trace call.
00056 //  FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY!
00057 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00058 
00059 extern SC_API void sc_deprecated_add_trace();
00060 
00061 struct SC_API sc_trace_params
00062 {
00063     sc_trace_file*        tf;
00064     std::string      name;
00065 
00066     sc_trace_params( sc_trace_file* tf_, const std::string& name_ )
00067         : tf( tf_ ), name( name_ )
00068         {}
00069 };
00070 
00071 
00072 typedef std::vector<sc_trace_params*> sc_trace_params_vec;

00081 template <class T>
00082 class sc_in
00083 : public sc_port<sc_signal_in_if<T>,1,SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00084 {
00085 public:
00086 
00087     // typedefs
00088 
00089     typedef T                                             data_type;
00090 
00091     typedef sc_signal_in_if<data_type>                    if_type;
00092     typedef sc_port<if_type,1,SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>       base_type;
00093     typedef sc_in<data_type>                              this_type;
00094     typedef typename base_type::port_type                 base_port_type;
00095 
00096     typedef if_type                                       in_if_type;
00097     typedef base_type                                     in_port_type;
00098     typedef sc_signal_inout_if<data_type>                 inout_if_type;
00099     typedef sc_port<inout_if_type,1,SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND> inout_port_type;
00100 
00101 public:
00102 
00103     // constructors
00104 
00105     sc_in()
00106         : base_type(), m_traces( 0 ),
00107           m_change_finder_p(0)
00108         {}
00109

00111         : base_type( name_ ), m_traces( 0 ),
00112           m_change_finder_p(0)
00113         {}
00114 
00115     explicit sc_in( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00116         : base_type( const_cast<in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ), m_traces( 0 ),
00117           m_change_finder_p(0)
00118         {}
00119 
00120     sc_in( const char* name_, const in_if_type& interface_ )
00121         : base_type( name_, const_cast<in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ), m_traces( 0 ),
00122           m_change_finder_p(0)
00123         {}
00124 
00125     explicit sc_in( in_port_type& parent_ )
00126         : base_type( parent_ ), m_traces( 0 ),
00127           m_change_finder_p(0)
00128         {}
00129 
00130     sc_in( const char* name_, in_port_type& parent_ )
00131         : base_type( name_, parent_ ), m_traces( 0 ),
00132           m_change_finder_p(0)
00133         {}
00134 
00135     explicit sc_in( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00136         : base_type(), m_traces( 0 ),
00137           m_change_finder_p(0)
00138         { sc_port_base::bind( parent_ ); }
00139 
00140     sc_in( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
00141         : base_type( name_ ), m_traces( 0 ),
00142           m_change_finder_p(0)
00143         { sc_port_base::bind( parent_ ); }
00144 
00145     sc_in( this_type& parent_ )
00146         : base_type( parent_ ), m_traces( 0 ),
00147           m_change_finder_p(0)
00148         {}
00149 
00150     sc_in( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
00151         : base_type( name_, parent_ ), m_traces( 0 ),
00152           m_change_finder_p(0)
00153         {}
00154 
00155 
00156     // destructor
00157 
00158     virtual ~sc_in()
00159         {
00160             remove_traces();
00161             delete m_change_finder_p;
00162         }
00163 
00164 
00165     // bind to in interface
00166 
00167     SC_VIRTUAL_ void bind( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00168         { sc_port_base::bind( const_cast<in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ); }
00169 
00170     SC_VIRTUAL_ void bind( in_if_type& interface_ )
00171         { this->bind( const_cast<const in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ); }
00172 
00173     void operator () ( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00174         { this->bind( interface_ ); }
00175 
00176 
00177     // bind to parent in port
00178 
00179     SC_VIRTUAL_ void bind( in_port_type& parent_ )
00180         { sc_port_base::bind( parent_ ); }
00181 
00182     void operator () ( in_port_type& parent_ )
00183         { this->bind( parent_ ); }
00184 
00185 
00186     // bind to parent inout port

00190 
00191     void operator () ( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00192         { this->bind( parent_ ); }
00193 
00194 
00195     // interface access shortcut methods
00196 
00197     // get the default event
00198 
00199     const sc_event& default_event() const
00200         { return (*this)->default_event(); }
00201 
00202 
00203     // get the value changed event
00204 
00205     const sc_event& value_changed_event() const
00206         { return (*this)->value_changed_event(); }
00207

00224     // (other) event finder method(s)
00225

00227     {
00228         return sc_event_finder::cached_create
00229                 ( m_change_finder_p, *this, &in_if_type::value_changed_event );
00230     }

00233     // called when elaboration is done

00264

00266         { sc_port_base::bind( parent_ ); }

00277 
00278 #ifdef __GNUC__
00279     // Needed to circumvent a problem in the g++-2.95.2 compiler:
00280     // This unused variable forces the compiler to instantiate
00281     // an object of T template so an implicit conversion from
00282     // read() to a C++ intrinsic data type will work.
00283     static data_type dummy;
00284 #endif

00286 
00287 template<typename T>
00288 ::std::ostream& operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_in<T>& a )
00289 {
00290     return os << a->read();
00291 }
00292 
00293 // IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
00294 
00295 
00296 // called when elaboration is done
00297 
00298 template <class T>
00299 inline
00300 void
00301 sc_in<T>::end_of_elaboration()
00302 {
00303     if( m_traces != 0 ) {
00304         for( int i = 0; i < (int)m_traces->size(); ++ i ) {
00305             sc_trace_params* p = (*m_traces)[i];
00306             in_if_type* iface = dynamic_cast<in_if_type*>( this->get_interface() );
00307             sc_trace( p->tf, iface->read(), p->name );
00308         }
00309         remove_traces();
00310     }
00311 }
00312 
00313 
00314 // called by sc_trace
00315 
00316 template <class T>
00317 inline
00318 void
00319 sc_in<T>::add_trace_internal( sc_trace_file* tf_, const std::string& name_ )
00320 const
00321 {
00322     if( tf_ != 0 ) {
00323         if( m_traces == 0 ) {
00324             m_traces = new sc_trace_params_vec;
00325         }
00326         m_traces->push_back( new sc_trace_params( tf_, name_ ) );
00327     }
00328 }
00329 
00330 template <class T>
00331 inline
00332 void
00333 sc_in<T>::add_trace( sc_trace_file* tf_, const std::string& name_ )
00334 const
00335 {
00336     sc_deprecated_add_trace();
00337     add_trace_internal(tf_, name_);
00338 }
00339 
00340 template <class T>
00341 inline
00342 void
00343 sc_in<T>::remove_traces() const
00344 {
00345     if( m_traces != 0 ) {
00346         for( int i = (int)m_traces->size() - 1; i >= 0; -- i ) {
00347             delete (*m_traces)[i];
00348         }
00349         delete m_traces;
00350         m_traces = 0;
00351     }
00352 }
00353 
00354 
00355 // called by pbind (for internal use only)
00356 
00357 template <class T>
00358 inline
00359 int
00360 sc_in<T>::vbind( sc_interface& interface_ )
00361 {
00362     return sc_port_b<if_type>::vbind( interface_ );
00363 }
00364 
00365 template <class T>
00366 inline
00367 int
00368 sc_in<T>::vbind( sc_port_base& parent_ )
00369 {
00370     in_port_type* in_parent = dynamic_cast<in_port_type*>( &parent_ );
00371     if( in_parent != 0 ) {
00372         sc_port_base::bind( *in_parent );
00373         return 0;
00374     }
00375     inout_port_type* inout_parent = dynamic_cast<inout_port_type*>( &parent_ );
00376     if( inout_parent != 0 ) {
00377         sc_port_base::bind( *inout_parent );
00378         return 0;
00379     }
00380     // type mismatch
00381     return 2;
00382 }

00649 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

00657 template <>
00658 class SC_API sc_in<sc_dt::sc_logic>
00659 : public sc_port<sc_signal_in_if<sc_dt::sc_logic>,1,SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00660 {
00661 public:
00662 
00663     // typedefs
00664 
00665     typedef sc_dt::sc_logic                               data_type;
00666 
00667     typedef sc_signal_in_if<data_type>                    if_type;
00668     typedef sc_port<if_type,1,SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>       base_type;
00669     typedef sc_in<data_type>                              this_type;
00670     typedef /* typename */ base_type::port_type           base_port_type;
00671 
00672     typedef if_type                                       in_if_type;
00673     typedef base_type                                     in_port_type;
00674     typedef sc_signal_inout_if<data_type>                 inout_if_type;
00675     typedef sc_port<inout_if_type,1,SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND> inout_port_type;
00676 
00677 public:
00678 
00679     // constructors
00680 
00681     sc_in()
00682         : base_type(), m_traces( 0 ),
00683           m_change_finder_p(0), m_neg_finder_p(0), m_pos_finder_p(0)
00684         {}

00688           m_change_finder_p(0), m_neg_finder_p(0), m_pos_finder_p(0)
00689         {}

00692         : base_type( const_cast<in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ), m_traces( 0 ),
00693           m_change_finder_p(0), m_neg_finder_p(0), m_pos_finder_p(0)
00694         {}
00695

00697         : base_type( name_, const_cast<in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ), m_traces( 0 ),
00698           m_change_finder_p(0), m_neg_finder_p(0), m_pos_finder_p(0)
00699         {}

00704         {}

00727         : base_type( name_, parent_ ), m_traces( 0 ),

00729         {}

00736             remove_traces();

00739             delete m_pos_finder_p;
00740         }
00741

00746         { sc_port_base::bind( const_cast<in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ); }
00747 
00748     SC_VIRTUAL_ void bind( in_if_type& interface_ )
00749         { this->bind( const_cast<const in_if_type&>( interface_ ) ); }
00750 
00751     void operator () ( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00752         { this->bind( interface_ ); }
00753 
00754 
00755     // bind to parent in port
00756 
00757     SC_VIRTUAL_ void bind( in_port_type& parent_ )
00758         { sc_port_base::bind( parent_ ); }
00759 
00760     void operator () ( in_port_type& parent_ )
00761         { this->bind( parent_ ); }
00762 
00763 
00764     // bind to parent inout port
00765 
00766     SC_VIRTUAL_ void bind( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00767         { sc_port_base::bind( parent_ ); }
00768 
00769     void operator () ( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00770         { this->bind( parent_ ); }
00771 
00772 
00773     // interface access shortcut methods
00774 
00775     // get the default event
00776 
00777     const sc_event& default_event() const
00778         { return (*this)->default_event(); }
00779 
00780 
00781     // get the value changed event
00782 
00783     const sc_event& value_changed_event() const
00784         { return (*this)->value_changed_event(); }
00785 
00786     // get the positive edge event
00787 
00788     const sc_event& posedge_event() const
00789         { return (*this)->posedge_event(); }
00790 
00791     // get the negative edge event
00792 
00793     const sc_event& negedge_event() const
00794         { return (*this)->negedge_event(); }
00795

00798 
00799     const data_type& read() const
00800         { return (*this)->read(); }
00801 
00802     operator const data_type& () const
00803         { return (*this)->read(); }
00804 
00805 
00806     // use for positive edge sensitivity
00807 
00808     sc_event_finder& pos() const
00809     {
00810         return sc_event_finder::cached_create
00811                 ( m_pos_finder_p, *this, &in_if_type::posedge_event );
00812     }
00813 
00814     // use for negative edge sensitivity
00815 
00816     sc_event_finder& neg() const
00817     {
00818         return sc_event_finder::cached_create
00819                 ( m_neg_finder_p, *this, &in_if_type::negedge_event );
00820     }
00821 
00822 
00823     // was there a value changed event?
00824 
00825     bool event() const
00826         { return (*this)->event(); }
00827 
00828     // was there a positive edge event?
00829 
00830     bool posedge() const
00831         { return (*this)->posedge(); }
00832 
00833     // was there a negative edge event?
00834 
00835     bool negedge() const
00836         { return (*this)->negedge(); }
00837 
00838     // (other) event finder method(s)
00839 
00840     sc_event_finder& value_changed() const
00841     {
00842         return sc_event_finder::cached_create
00843                 ( m_change_finder_p, *this, &in_if_type::value_changed_event );
00844     }
00845 
00846 
00847     // called when elaboration is done
00848     /*  WHEN DEFINING THIS METHOD IN A DERIVED CLASS, */
00849     /*  MAKE SURE THAT THIS METHOD IS CALLED AS WELL. */
00850 
00851     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00852 
00853     virtual const char* kind() const
00854         { return "sc_in"; }
00855 
00856 
00857     void add_trace( sc_trace_file*, const std::string& ) const;
00858 
00859     // called by sc_trace
00860     void add_trace_internal( sc_trace_file*, const std::string& ) const;
00861 
00862 protected:
00863 
00864     void remove_traces() const;
00865 
00866     mutable sc_trace_params_vec* m_traces;
00867 
00868 protected:
00869 
00870     // called by pbind (for internal use only)
00871     virtual int vbind( sc_interface& );
00872     virtual int vbind( sc_port_base& );
00873 
00874     // implement virtual base_type port-binding function
00875     //  - avoids warnings on some compilers
00876     //  - should only be called, when using sc_port_b explicitly
00877     //  - errors are detected during elaboration
00878 
00879     SC_VIRTUAL_ void bind( base_port_type& parent_ )
00880         { sc_port_base::bind( parent_ ); }
00881 
00882 private:
00883   mutable sc_event_finder* m_change_finder_p;
00884   mutable sc_event_finder* m_neg_finder_p;
00885   mutable sc_event_finder* m_pos_finder_p;
00886 
00887 private:
00888 
00889     // disabled
00890     sc_in( const this_type& );
00891     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& );
00892 
00893 #ifdef __GNUC__
00894     // Needed to circumvent a problem in the g++-2.95.2 compiler:
00895     // This unused variable forces the compiler to instantiate
00896     // an object of T template so an implicit conversion from
00897     // read() to a C++ intrinsic data type will work.
00898     static data_type dummy;
00899 #endif
00900 };

01089 ::std::ostream& operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_inout<T>& a )
01090 {

01093 
01094 // IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
01095 
01096 
01097 // destructor
01098 
01099 template <class T>
01100 inline
01101 sc_inout<T>::~sc_inout()
01102 {
01103     delete m_change_finder_p;
01104     delete m_init_val;
01105     remove_traces();
01106 }
01107 
01108 
01109 // set initial value (can also be called when port is not bound yet)
01110 
01111 template <class T>
01112 inline
01113 void
01114 sc_inout<T>::initialize( const data_type& value_ )
01115 {
01116     inout_if_type* iface = dynamic_cast<inout_if_type*>( this->get_interface() );
01117     if( iface != 0 ) {
01118         iface->write( value_ );
01119     } else {
01120         if( m_init_val == 0 ) {
01121             m_init_val = new data_type;
01122         }
01123         *m_init_val = value_;
01124     }
01125 }
01126 
01127 
01128 // called when elaboration is done
01129 
01130 template <class T>
01131 inline
01132 void
01133 sc_inout<T>::end_of_elaboration()
01134 {
01135     if( m_init_val != 0 ) {
01136         write( *m_init_val );
01137         delete m_init_val;
01138         m_init_val = 0;
01139     }
01140     if( m_traces != 0 ) {
01141         for( int i = 0; i < (int)m_traces->size(); ++ i ) {
01142             sc_trace_params* p = (*m_traces)[i];
01143             in_if_type* iface = dynamic_cast<in_if_type*>( this->get_interface() );
01144             sc_trace( p->tf, iface->read(), p->name );
01145         }
01146         remove_traces();
01147     }
01148 }
01149 
01150 
01151 // called by sc_trace
01152 
01153 template <class T>
01154 inline
01155 void
01156 sc_inout<T>::add_trace_internal( sc_trace_file* tf_, const std::string& name_)
01157 const
01158 {
01159     if( tf_ != 0 ) {
01160             if( m_traces == 0 ) {
01161                 m_traces = new sc_trace_params_vec;
01162             }
01163             m_traces->push_back( new sc_trace_params( tf_, name_ ) );
01164     }
01165 }
01166 
01167 template <class T>
01168 inline
01169 void
01170 sc_inout<T>::add_trace( sc_trace_file* tf_, const std::string& name_) const
01171 {
01172     sc_deprecated_add_trace();
01173     add_trace_internal(tf_, name_);
01174 }
01175 
01176 template <class T>
01177 inline
01178 void
01179 sc_inout<T>::remove_traces() const
01180 {
01181     if( m_traces != 0 ) {
01182                 for( int i = static_cast<int>(m_traces->size()) - 1; i >= 0; -- i ) {
01183                 delete (*m_traces)[i];
01184                 }
01185                 delete m_traces;
01186                 m_traces = 0;
01187     }
01188 }
01189

01363     /*  WHEN DEFINING THIS METHOD IN A DERIVED CLASS, */
01364     /*  MAKE SURE THAT THIS METHOD IS CALLED AS WELL. */
01365 
01366     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
01367 
01368 
01369     // (other) event finder method(s)
01370 
01371     sc_event_finder& value_changed() const
01372     {
01373         return sc_event_finder::cached_create
01374                 ( m_change_finder_p, *this, &in_if_type::value_changed_event );
01375     }
01376 
01377     virtual const char* kind() const
01378         { return "sc_inout"; }
01379 
01380 protected:
01381 
01382     data_type* m_init_val;
01383 
01384 public:
01385 
01386     // called by sc_trace
01387     void add_trace_internal( sc_trace_file*, const std::string& ) const;
01388 
01389     void add_trace( sc_trace_file*, const std::string& ) const;
01390 
01391 protected:
01392 
01393     void remove_traces() const;
01394 
01395     mutable sc_trace_params_vec* m_traces;
01396 
01397 private:
01398   mutable sc_event_finder* m_change_finder_p;
01399   mutable sc_event_finder* m_neg_finder_p;
01400   mutable sc_event_finder* m_pos_finder_p;
01401 
01402 private:
01403 
01404     // disabled
01405     sc_inout( const this_type& );
01406 
01407 #ifdef __GNUC__
01408     // Needed to circumvent a problem in the g++-2.95.2 compiler:
01409     // This unused variable forces the compiler to instantiate
01410     // an object of T template so an implicit conversion from
01411     // read() to a C++ intrinsic data type will work.
01412     static data_type dummy;
01413 #endif
01414 };

01643 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01644 //  CLASS : sc_out<T>
01645 //
01646 //  The sc_signal<T> output port class.
01647 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01648 
01649 // sc_out can also read from its port, hence no difference with sc_inout.
01650 // For debugging reasons, a class is provided instead of a define.
01651 
01652 template <class T>
01653 class sc_out
01654 : public sc_inout<T>
01655 {
01656 public:
01657 
01658     // typedefs
01659 
01660     typedef T                                   data_type;
01661 
01662     typedef sc_out<data_type>                   this_type;
01663     typedef sc_inout<data_type>                 base_type;
01664 
01665     typedef typename base_type::in_if_type      in_if_type;
01666     typedef typename base_type::in_port_type    in_port_type;
01667     typedef typename base_type::inout_if_type   inout_if_type;
01668     typedef typename base_type::inout_port_type inout_port_type;
01669 
01670 public:
01671 
01672     // constructors
01673 
01674     sc_out()
01675         : base_type()
01676         {}
01677 
01678     explicit sc_out( const char* name_ )
01679         : base_type( name_ )
01680         {}
01681 
01682     explicit sc_out( inout_if_type& interface_ )
01683         : base_type( interface_ )
01684         {}
01685 
01686     sc_out( const char* name_, inout_if_type& interface_ )
01687         : base_type( name_, interface_ )
01688         {}
01689 
01690     explicit sc_out( inout_port_type& parent_ )
01691         : base_type( parent_ )
01692         {}
01693 
01694     sc_out( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
01695         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
01696         {}
01697 
01698     sc_out( this_type& parent_ )
01699         : base_type( parent_ )
01700         {}
01701 
01702     sc_out( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
01703         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
01704         {}
01705 
01706 
01707     // destructor (does nothing)
01708 
01709     virtual ~sc_out()
01710         {}
01711 
01712 
01713     // write the new value
01714 
01715     this_type& operator = ( const data_type& value_ )
01716         { (*this)->write( value_ ); return *this; }
01717 
01718     this_type& operator = ( const in_if_type& interface_ )
01719         { (*this)->write( interface_.read() ); return *this; }
01720 
01721     this_type& operator = ( const in_port_type& port_ )
01722         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
01723 
01724     this_type& operator = ( const inout_port_type& port_ )
01725         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
01726 
01727     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& port_ )
01728         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
01729 
01730     virtual const char* kind() const
01731         { return "sc_out"; }
01732 
01733 private:
01734 
01735     // disabled
01736     sc_out( const this_type& );
01737 };

01740 // IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
01741 
01742 
01743 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01744 //  FUNCTION : sc_trace
01745 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01746 
01747 template <class T>
01748 inline
01749 void
01750 sc_trace(sc_trace_file* tf, const sc_in<T>& port, const std::string& name)
01751 {
01752     const sc_signal_in_if<T>* iface = 0;
01753     if (sc_get_curr_simcontext()->elaboration_done() )
01754     {
01755         iface = dynamic_cast<const sc_signal_in_if<T>*>( port.get_interface() );
01756     }
01757 
01758     if ( iface )
01759         sc_trace( tf, iface->read(), name );
01760     else
01761         port.add_trace_internal( tf, name );
01762 }
01763 
01764 template <class T>
01765 inline
01766 void
01767 sc_trace( sc_trace_file* tf, const sc_inout<T>& port,
01768     const std::string& name )
01769 {
01770     const sc_signal_in_if<T>* iface = 0;
01771     if (sc_get_curr_simcontext()->elaboration_done() )
01772     {
01773         iface = dynamic_cast<const sc_signal_in_if<T>*>( port.get_interface() );
01774     }
01775 
01776     if ( iface )
01777         sc_trace( tf, iface->read(), name );
01778     else
01779         port.add_trace_internal( tf, name );
01780 }
01781 
01782 } // namespace sc_core

01792   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
01793   changes you are making here.
01794 
01795       Name, Affiliation, Date:  Jason Elbaum, Motorola, Inc., 2001-11-12
01796   Description of Modification:  Added a static, private, otherwise
01797                                 unused data member to the sc_in
01798                                 and sc_inout classes to address
01799                                 a bug in the GNU compiler *only*.
01800                                 This works around a bug in g++ 2.95.2
01801                                 regarding implicit casting from a
01802                                 templated class to a C++ intrinsic type.

01849 // classes so that sc_trace has something to call that won't emit an

01853 // Andy Goodrich: changed sc_event instances into pointers to sc_event instances
01854 // that are allocated as needed. This saves considerable storage for large
01855 // numbers of signals, etc.
01856 //
01857 //Revision 1.8  2006/02/02 23:42:37  acg
01858 // Andy Goodrich: implemented a much better fix to the sc_event_finder
01859 // proliferation problem. This new version allocates only a single event
01860 // finder for each port for each type of event, e.g., pos(), neg(), and
01861 // value_change(). The event finder persists as long as the port does,
01862 // which is what the LRM dictates. Because only a single instance is
01863 // allocated for each event type per port there is not a potential
01864 // explosion of storage as was true in the 2.0.1/2.1 versions.
